name: Average price idea (I don't buy it)
description: I strongly disagree with the idea of ​​Average Price being used as a guide to valuing one's artwork, and I strongly disagree that people warn of joining #HEN1000 for the reason that posting in Tezos chain with a large number of small values ​​means the average price the artist can set for the next piece, even if the new piece is not the same as the one featured in #HEN1000. Everyone has the right to choose any belief set. You can apply the Regression model to the Iris Flower Dataset. It's your right. But would it be better? If you can rationally explain the reasoning behind your use of this principle. It's not because someone tells you to use it without really understanding how it works.
